abstract: Xbox Live, Microsoft’s gaming network that serves some six million Xbox users, is scheduled to be opened to PC gamers on May 8.
snippet: Xbox Live, Microsoft’s gaming network that serves some six million Xbox users, is scheduled to be opened to PC gamers on May 8.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft announced yesterday that it was extending the online gaming service for its Xbox consoles to the millions of people who use Windows PCs to play games over the Internet, a move that could bolster the popularity — and profits — of video gaming.

headline.main: Microsoft to Open Its Online Gaming Service to Windows Users
headline.print_headline: Microsoft to Open Its Online Gaming Service, Once Just for Xbox, to Windows Users

abstract: For months, pundits have been kicking around the (wildly speculative) idea of Microsoft buying Yahoo to take on Google, the giant of the Web search world. John Battelle, the editor of SearchBlog, a blog on search technology, was among them. But now Mr. Battelle, who also founded the online ad network Federated Media Publishing, thinks he has a better idea, though one he admits might sound “crazy”: a joint venture between the two companies to create a “search monetization” business.
lead_paragraph: For months, pundits have been kicking around the (wildly speculative) idea of Microsoft buying Yahoo to take on Google, the giant of the Web search world. John Battelle, the editor of SearchBlog, a blog on search technology, was among them. But now Mr. Battelle, who also founded the online ad network Federated Media Publishing, thinks he has a better idea, though one he admits might sound “crazy”: a joint venture between the two companies to create a “search monetization” business.

headline.main: Yet More Musings on a Microsoft-Yahoo Deal

abstract: Confirming reports that it was close a deal, Microsoft said Wednesday that it would buy Tellme Networks, an speech-recognition technology company. In a statement, Microsoft said that it plans to integrate Tellme’s products into its mobile offerings, with a long-term goal of integrating the technology into the rest of its lineup.
lead_paragraph: Confirming reports that it was close a deal, Microsoft said Wednesday that it would buy Tellme Networks, an speech-recognition technology company. In a statement, Microsoft said that it plans to integrate Tellme’s products into its mobile offerings, with a long-term goal of integrating the technology into the rest of its lineup.

headline.main: Microsoft to Buy Speech Technology Company
